overview.title: Roadmap Overview
overview.description: Our approach (YC-style + Agile). We'll build a venture-scale product by starting with real market pain, then moving fast through validate → ship → learn → iterate, using 2-week sprints (Agile). We will stay YC-style by continuously talking to users, building something users can touch early, launching fast, and iterating based on real behavior (not opinions).
commitments: Find a problem via market analytics + user/CEO interviews
Build a clickable prototype early to "show, not tell" during interviews
Decide direction quickly and ship a scrappy MVP v0 fast
Build business strategy in parallel (monetization, GTM, metrics, goals)
Publish traction/results with proof (demos, changelogs, metrics snapshots)
Evolve into a quarterly roadmap with measurable outcomes

sprints.title: Discovery + Clickable Prototype
sprints.goal: Learn fast from real users and validate direction with something tangible

weeks_detail.title: Interviews + Market Signal Collection
weeks_detail.summary: Run 10-15 interviews, capture pain points, and start market analytics

product: Define 2–3 target customer profiles (ICPs)
Create interview script + insights database (structure for notes + tags + pain clusters)
Run interviews aggressively (target: 10–15 interviews this week, mix of users + founders/CEOs)

Capture in every interview: what problem is most painful right now, how often it happens (frequency), what they do today (workflow), what tools/substitutes they use, what they pay for / where budget exists, what "success" looks like
business: Start market analytics (where money/time is spent; what's growing; what's broken)
Quick competitor scan (fast, not deep): direct competitors, indirect substitutes, "do nothing"
design: Mood board + brand principles (tone, visuals, what we stand for)
Starter palette + typography direction (enough for website + post templates)
team: Launch hiring pipeline + trial tasks for: User Researcher (assistant-level), Community Moderator
Start CTO / technical lead conversations (but we don't block MVP on hiring)
Start video editor pipeline (optional early, can be contractor)
marketing: Publish website roadmap page + "build in public" cadence (2–3 updates/week)
Publish Sprint 1 update post: what we're doing, how we measure results
Start content workflow setup (hooks list, posting process, template-based workflow)
token: Publish transparency policy: what actions we'll take and how it's verifiable (proof links structure)
Keep it factual; no hype; focus remains on product + users

results: Roadmap website live + update cadence live
Brand starter kit v0 ready (basic templates)

weeks_detail.title: Clickable Prototype + "Show, Don't Tell" Interviews
weeks_detail.summary: Build and test clickable prototype with 10-15 more interviews

product: Continue interviews aggressively (target: 10–15 more interviews this week)
Convert the top pain clusters into 2–3 solution concepts
Build a clickable prototype (Figma or equivalent) for the top concept(s)

Run prototype interviews and test: clarity of the workflow (where users get stuck), perceived value ("this solves it" vs "nice-to-have"), willingness to try now (commitment), willingness to pay (early signal), next step action (pilot, onboarding call, waitlist signup)
business: Define problem scoring framework clearly: urgency, frequency, willingness-to-pay, market size, wedge speed
Score and rank top 3 problem directions
End the week with a clear front-runner (or top 2 if still close)
design: Prototype UX: minimum steps to deliver value
Keep design simple; optimize for clarity and speed
team: Run trial tasks for researcher/moderator and move toward "trial → hire"
Narrow CTO/builder path options (CTO partner vs solo build vs contractor)
marketing: Publish Sprint 1 recap (sanitized learnings + what we're building next)
Run community input (voting / comments) to pressure-test the pain clusters
token: Continue transparency actions + publish proof links on schedule

results: Clickable prototype tested with real users (5–10 prototype sessions)
MVP v0 scope outline drafted (what we build in Sprint 2)
Public update post published (insights + next sprint plan)

sprints.title: Choose One Direction + Build + Launch MVP v0
sprints.goal: Choose one direction and launch MVP v0 to real users by the end of Sprint 2

weeks_detail.title: MVP Build Starts + Fast Validation Loops
weeks_detail.summary: Confirm direction, define MVP scope tightly, and start building immediately

product: Confirm final problem direction (based on Sprint 1 evidence + follow-up calls if needed)
Define MVP scope tightly: core workflow only, no extras
Start building MVP v0 immediately
Keep user contact active: short feedback loops (daily or every 2–3 days)
business: Draft business strategy v1 (short, explicit assumptions): target customer, pricing hypothesis, expected value delivered, early unit economics assumptions
Define metrics + goals for MVP v0: activation definition (Aha moment), retention baseline target (early), frequency target (core actions per week)
design: Turn prototype into real UI for MVP (minimal but usable)
Update design system starter components needed for MVP
team: Confirm MVP builder path and weekly shipping cadence
marketing: Publish "what we're building + why" post (high-level, non-sensitive)
Create waitlist + onboarding pipeline (signup → onboarding → feedback)
Publish a simple changelog format
token: Maintain transparency actions + proof page on site

results: MVP v0 build in progress (core workflow implemented)
Onboarding pipeline ready (waitlist + first user scheduling)
Metrics tracking definitions set (what we measure + why)

weeks_detail.title: Launch MVP v0 + Onboard First Users
weeks_detail.summary: Launch MVP v0 and onboard first cohort of 10-30 design partners

product: Launch MVP v0 (usable by real users)
Onboard first cohort (target: 10–30 design partners)
Collect feedback daily + prioritize fixes/iterations
Instrument analytics and establish baseline metrics
business: Monetization experiment plan drafted (what we test first)
Decide first revenue pathway to validate (pilot / paid test / conversion trigger)
design: Polish core UX enough for daily usage (remove friction)
Create asset pack for announcements + product visuals
team: Add design support if needed (contract is fine)
Start finance/revenue-model support search (advisor or part-time)
marketing: Weekly demo + changelog update
Collect testimonials/clips (permission-based)

results: MVP v0 shipped and used by real users

deliverables: Business strategy v1 + metrics framework v1

sprints.title: Onboard + Iterate + First Traction Signals
sprints.goal: Increase repeat usage and tighten the core loop based on real behavior

weeks_detail.title: Improve Time-to-Value + Ship Iterations
weeks_detail.summary: Improve onboarding flow and ship 1-2 iterations based on user behavior

product: Improve onboarding (reduce steps to reach "Aha moment")
Ship 1–2 iterations based on user behavior
Run weekly user calls + daily feedback capture
business: Start monetization validation (soft tests): willingness-to-pay conversations, pilot offers (founder-led) if B2B
Define GTM wedge hypothesis (channel/loop to test)
design: Fix UX friction points identified in Week 4
Strengthen consistency of UI + community visuals
marketing: Publish progress update (what changed, what we learned)
Keep content engine consistent (focus on what drives signups)

results: Clear list of top friction points + fixes shipped

weeks_detail.title: Expand Onboarding + Validate Pull
weeks_detail.summary: Onboard more users with repeatable process and ship retention-focused iterations

product: Onboard additional users with a repeatable process
Ship 1–2 more iterations (retention-focused)
Identify the core action that predicts retention
business: Monetization experiment plan finalized (pricing test design)
GTM wedge test launched (one primary channel/loop)
team: Bring in finance/revenue-model support if revenue modeling becomes urgent
Add support/mod capacity if community load increases
marketing: Publish Sprint 3 recap + early traction signals (sanitized)
Collect testimonials/clips and build a case library

results: First monetization signal (pilot or paid test discussions started)

deliverables: Traction snapshot v0 (users, usage, retention trend)

sprints.title: Retention + Pricing Tests + Channel Focus
sprints.goal: Prove product pull more clearly and narrow to what scales

weeks_detail.title: Retention Work + Pricing Test Setup
weeks_detail.summary: Fix onboarding bottlenecks and launch pricing tests

product: Fix remaining onboarding bottlenecks
Add only retention-driving features (no bloat)
business: Launch pricing tests: free → paid conversion experiments (if applicable), pilot pricing offers (founder-led sales)
Choose the best-performing channel signals to focus on
marketing: Publish "traction so far" update (learnings + what's next)
Double down on content/channel that produces signups

results: Clear signal on which channel is most promising

weeks_detail.title: Improve Retention + Focus GTM
weeks_detail.summary: Ship multiple improvement cycles and select primary GTM wedge

product: Ship 2–4 cycles of improvements based on data
Make time-to-value and repeat usage the core focus
business: Select the GTM wedge (one primary growth path)
Document funnel assumptions and next tests
team: Identify gaps (ops, legal, analytics) and cover critical ones
marketing: Publish Sprint 4 recap + what we're scaling next

sprints.title: Scale System + Revenue Model v1 + Quarterly Roadmap
sprints.goal: Operationalize scaling and publish an ambitious quarterly plan grounded in real data

weeks_detail.title: Scale Onboarding + Clarify Revenue Model
weeks_detail.summary: Define MVP v1 scope and draft revenue model v1

product: MVP v1 scope defined (based on retention + usage)
Define next 90-day product bets
business: Revenue model v1 drafted: pricing tiers, assumptions and constraints, expansion path, break-even logic (simple, explicit)
marketing: Scale the highest-performing acquisition loop
Maintain weekly demo/changelog cadence

weeks_detail.title: Publish Quarterly Plan + GTM v1
weeks_detail.summary: Publish quarterly roadmap, GTM strategy, and transparency summary

business: GTM strategy v1 published: channels, funnel, partnership angles, key experiments for the next quarter
Metrics/OKRs for the next quarter finalized
design: Brand kit v1 updated (consistent product + content visuals)
team: Confirm CTO/tech leadership structure for speed and reliability
marketing: Publish quarterly roadmap + GTM plan
Publish "first 10 weeks" recap
token: Continue scheduled token buyback (daily or weekly): we buy a defined percent of Alexa supply (%) on a fixed schedule and lock it for a defined period (months)
Publish a 10-week transparency summary with wallet proof links (buys + lockups), alongside the product progress recap

results: Quarterly roadmap published (high-level milestones + metrics targets)
Revenue model v1 + GTM v1 published
Scaling cadence established (shipping + onboarding + content engine)
Scheduled buyback + lockup plan executed consistently, with proof links published

quarters.title: Launch + First Pull
milestones: Clickable prototype tested with real users
MVP v0 shipped and used by real users
Weekly shipping cadence + onboarding cadence running
First monetization signal started (pilot / paid test / strong willingness-to-pay)

quarters.title: Retention + Monetization + Repeatable Acquisition
milestones: MVP v1 built around retention drivers
Pricing validated through real conversions or pilots
Community + content engine reliably generating signups

quarters.title: Scale + Expansion
milestones: Add product depth that increases retention/expansion
Expand to adjacent ICPs or move upmarket only if retention + monetization are strong
